Cadar dan Celana Cingkrang Dilarang di Lingkungan Kemenag
02 Nov 2019, 12:50 by Fikri Arigi, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Wakil Menteri Agama Zainut Tauhid mengatakan pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang oleh Aparatur Sipil Negara (ASN) hanya berlaku di lingkungan Kementerian Agama. Ia meminta pihak lain tidak menanggapinya secara berlebihan.
“Hal tersebut hanya sebatas untuk penertiban dan penegakan disiplin pegawai di lingkungan Kementerian Agama. Sehingga tidak perlu ditanggapi secara emosional, berlebihan, dan penuh dengan kecurigaan,” kata Zainut dalam keterangan tertulisnya, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Zainut berpendapat langkah penertiban dan penegakkan disiplin seperti itu adalah tindakan yang wajar dan bagian dari tugas pembinaan agar ASN mematuhi aturan yang ditetapkan. Menurutnya, hal ini tak peru dikaitkan dengan pelanggaran hak privasi seseorang, apalagi dengan kebebasan beragama.
“Karena dalam penertiban dan penegakan disiplin tersebut dipastikan tidak ada satu pun ajaran agama, hak privasi atau hak asasi seseorang dalam menjalankan ajaran agama yang dilanggar,” kata dia.
Ketentuan seragam ASN, Polri, dan TNI, kata Zainut, sudah ada dan tetap mengindahkan nilai estetika, etika, dan tak bertentangan dengan ajaran agama. Sehingga ketentuan itu harus ditaati oleh semua ASN.
Sebelumnya Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi mengatakan ASN yang mengenakan celana cingkrang sebagai hal yang tidak sesuai aturan. Meski tak bisa dipersoalkan dari segi agama, Fachrul menyebut celana cingkrang melanggar aturan berpakaian ASN.
Sedangkan cadar ia sebut berbahaya karena menutupi muka, sehingga sulit diidentifikasi. “Saya nggak sebut cadar lah. Kan bahaya orang masuk nggak tahu itu mukanya siapa,” tutur Fachrul.

Veils and Cingkrang Pants Are Prohibited in the Ministry of Religion
02 Nov 2019, 12:50 by Fikri Arigi, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Deputy Minister of Religion Zainut Tauhid said the ban on veils and trousers by the State Civil Service (ASN) only applies within the Ministry of Religion. He asked the other party not to overreact.
"This is only limited to the discipline and enforcement of employee discipline within the Ministry of Religion. So there is no need to respond emotionally, excessively, and full of suspicion, "Zainut said in his written statement, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Zainut believes such disciplinary measures and enforcement are reasonable actions and part of the guidance task so that ASN complies with the established rules. According to him, this should not be associated with violations of one's privacy rights, especially with religious freedom.
"Because in the discipline and enforcement of these disciplines it is certain that none of the religious teachings, privacy rights or human rights of a person in carrying out religious teachings are violated," he said.
The provisions of the ASN, Polri and TNI uniforms, said Zainut, already exist and continue to heed the aesthetic, ethical, and not contrary to religious teachings. So that the provisions must be obeyed by all ASNs.
Earlier, Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi said that ASN was wearing conical pants as not according to the rules. Although it cannot be questioned in terms of religion, Fachrul said the Cingkrang pants violated the ASN dress code.
While the veil he called dangerous because it covers the face, so it is difficult to identify. "I don't call the veil. It's dangerous for people to come in who doesn't know whose face it is, "said Fachrul.
